issues.description: The problem statement UML and the reference solution define StockIngredient.price as an int (constructor + field + getPrice returning int), but the template repository's StockIngredient uses a double for the price field and constructor/getPrice signatures. This type mismatch (int vs double) affects constructor signatures and the return type of getPrice, and can confuse students when they implement SealSaloon.calculateTotalPrice (which is specified to return int and whose parameter/logic in the solution assumes integer ingredient prices).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template consistent with the problem statement and solution by changing StockIngredient.price in the template to an int: update the price field type, the constructor parameter type (second parameter) to int, and getPrice() to return int. Ensure any template usages and tests (and comments) reflect the int price type. Alternatively, if prices are intended to be doubles, update the problem statement UML and the solution to use double consistently — but the cleaner fix is to update the template to int to match the specification and reference solution.
